title: (x) 'Federal' look-a-like - various {gang}
content:
I really like the ' [Federal](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126090106/http:/www.letterror.com/foundry/fed/index.html)' typeface, by [LettError](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126090106/http:/www.letterror.com/)..   
( [http://www.letterror.com/foundry/fed/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126090106/http:/www.letterror.com/foundry/fed/index.html) )   
   
As silly as it sounds, but I especially like the filled, non-shaded versions of it..   
So, now, my question would be, are there any other typefaces, that look kinda similar.?   
Could you please name some 'Federal' look-a-likes.?   
( I dont want a ripped off font hint, I am just seeking a similar style, if that makes any sense.. )   
   
\* In the need for better words.. \*   
   
Thanks a lot, fellow Tyophiles..
author: formlos

comments.content:
Thanks, Yves.. Any rounder ones.? ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126090106im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
( I like 'Federal' because it got a round and somehow organic feel to it..   
Especially the serifs themself and connections, so it seems.. )   
   
Hmm, does this make any sense.? Hopefully it does.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126090106im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

I don't know if this is adequately "kinda similar", but Uddi Uddi's [Jobbernole](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126090106/http:/www.fontsnthings.com/j/j02.html) (PC only, I'm afraid) will get you this:   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126090106im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/26195.gif)
